desc: mFixNaN performs various corrections associated with NaNs; either converting bad ones to another value or setting bad values to NaNs.

arguments.name: boundaries
arguments.desc: Some projections (e.g. Aitoff) have non-physical regions. This flag checks for those and converts them to NaN.

arguments.name: haveVal
arguments.desc: This flag indicates that NaNs should be converted to a different value.

arguments.name: NaNvalue
arguments.desc: Value to convert NaNs to.  Used when the NaNs in an image are incorrectly used.

arguments.name: minblank
arguments.desc: Min values for min/max ranges or standalone lower limits.

arguments.name: ismin
arguments.desc: Booleans indicating whether min values are min/max (0) or standalone lower limit.

arguments.name: maxblank
arguments.desc: Max values for min/max ranges or standalone upper limits.

arguments.name: ismax
arguments.desc: Booleans indicating whether each max value is part of a min/max range (0) or a standalone upper limit (1).

return.name: rangeCount
return.desc: Number of pixels found in the range(s) specified.

return.name: boundaryCount
return.desc: Number of pixels found in 'boundary' regions.
